title: Parents' tribute to mum found dead after being 'ripped apart' by fiance's death
text:

The parents of a mum found dead after going missing have paid a heartbreaking tribute to their daughter - who struggled with the 'pain' of losing her fiancé last year.

Helen Reilly, 35, visited friends on September 25 before disappearing.

Last week, Cheshire Police confirmed a body had been found in the River Mersey near Seacombe during the search for Helen.

She lost the 'love of her life' Kevin Reilly just weeks before the couple were due to get married last year.

Now, her grieving parents Gregg and Linda McBreen have led tributes to the 'wonderful mum' by writing a touching poem that was shared on social media.

They wrote: "There should have been a wedding but that was not to be because Helen lost her Kevin he was taken so suddenly.

"She really tried her best to cope and with their boys make a new start, but the pain of losing Kevin was still ripping out her heart.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Facebook)

"Well now there both together for all eternity, it's not the way they planned it but it's the way life made it be.

"Not a day will ever pass when we won't think of both of them and now we have to pull together to help there lads grow from boys to men. Love mum and dad."

Nicola Wright also paid tribute to Helen, saying she and Kevin would "finally get that beautiful wedding day wrapped in each others arms".

She added: "Be happy. Shine bright. Be all the things that you wanted to be. And above all never go to far away from us.

"Love and protect us in all the ways we cant do for each other.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

"Be the strength that keeps us on our feet when we fear we might stumble. Be the deep breath we take as we step into whatever our lives holds without you.

"We are lost, we are down and we are weakened but we will wont stay like that for long. We now have the most important job of all to do and thats be the pillars of strength, love, courage, patience, resilience, belief and compassion that will raise those boys into strong men.

"Men that will always know how much they truly truly are loved and how much their mum and dad fought to get them where they are today through all that life threw their way."

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

One childhood friend, 39-year-old Lisa Johnson, previously told Mirror Online: "This is a particularly sad story because her fiancé suddenly collapsed and died in front of her at home two weeks before their wedding day.

"It left her to care for their two young boys. Instead of planning the final touches to her wedding day, she had to plan a funeral."

"She was absolutely distraught. She really struggled afterwards but was managing because of her two boys."

Lisa told how since Kevin's death in August last year, Helen's worried mum Linda had become increasingly concerned.

A GoFundMe page has also been set up to support the family and Helen's two sons.

The page has raised almost £3,500.
description: Helen Reilly, 35, from Cheshire, lost the 'love of her life' Kevin Reilly in 2018 - weeks before the couple were due to get married
